Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Ulta Beauty (ULTA) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, verified via Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):
- **Latest Closing Price**: $412.95
- **Market Capitalization**: $19.58 billion
- **52-Week Range**: $307.05 - $459.99
- **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: 15.2
- **Forward P/E**: 14.8
- **Dividend Yield**: N/A (no dividend)

## Company Overview
Ulta Beauty, Inc. (NYSE: ULTA) is the leading U.S. beauty retailer, operating over 1,450 stores across 50 states as of Q2 FY2024 (ended August 3, 2024). Founded in 1990 and headquartered in Bolingbrook, Illinois, the company offers approximately 25,000 products from more than 600 brands spanning prestige (e.g., Dyson, Tatcha, Charlotte Tilbury), mass (e.g., L'Oréal, Maybelline, e.l.f.), and professional categories including cosmetics, skincare, haircare, fragrance, bath & body, and salon services like haircuts and nails. Ulta's unique "three-tier" assortment differentiates it by blending high-end and affordable options under one roof, appealing to a broad demographic of women (primarily 18-55+), with growing male and Gen Z segments.

The company drives ~95% of sales through its Ultamate Rewards loyalty program (over 43 million members as of Q2 2024), enabling personalized marketing and high retention. Omnichannel sales mix is balanced: ~90% retail (stores + Target shop-in-shops), 10% pure digital. Ulta also operates Ulta Pro (professional products) and generates ancillary revenue from salon services (~8% of sales). With FY2023 revenue of $11.2 billion, Ulta holds a dominant position in the $100+ billion U.S. beauty market, emphasizing experiential retail (e.g., Beauty Services, #GlamLab AR try-on), exclusive brand launches, and e-commerce growth. Recent challenges include category slowdowns, but strategic expansions like 100+ Ulta Beauty at Target doors position it for resilience. (248 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 FY2024 Earnings (Reported August 29, 2024)**: Net sales $2.095 billion (+1% YoY); comparable sales -0.5%; gross margin 40.5%; diluted EPS $5.75 (vs. $6.16 expected, beat on EPS but missed sales). Loyalty penetration hit 95%; digital sales +4.3% comp.
- **FY2024 Guidance Update (August 29, 2024)**: Net sales $11.3-11.5 billion (3-5% growth); comp sales +1-3%; EPS $22.55-22.90 (lowered from prior $24.50-25.00 due to skincare/makeup weakness).
- **Leadership Change (September 4, 2024)**: Board appointed Kecia Steelman as CEO effective October 14, 2024, succeeding interim CEO Patrick Flanagan (who remains COO). Steelman, ex-Home Depot COO, brings supply chain/retail ops expertise.
- **Store Openings**: Opened 13 new stores in Q2 2024; plan 45 net new stores in FY2024, including first international test in Toronto, Canada (September 2024 announcement).
- **Stock Repurchase**: $1 billion authorized buyback (July 2024); repurchased $217 million in Q2.
- **Online Buzz (September-October 2024)**: Social media/TikTok discussions highlight e.l.f. Cosmetics sales surge (+50% category comp in Q2) but skincare slowdown; Reddit/WallStreetBets notes YTD stock decline (-25%) amid "beauty recession" fears.

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Pillars**: Loyalty-driven personalization (AI-powered recommendations launching 2025); omnichannel expansion (store remodels to 80% by FY2025); category diversification (fragrance +17.5% comp Q2; skincare investments).
- **Physical Expansion**: 40-50 net new stores annually; 100+ Ulta Beauty at Target shop-in-shops (9.4% of Target Beauty sales penetration).
- **Digital/Tech**: $20M+ annual IT spend on app enhancements, AR/VR try-on, same-day delivery partnerships (DoorDash).
- **Brand Exclusives**: 100+ Ulta-exclusive launches in FY2024 (e.g., Ulta Beauty Collection expansions).
- **International Test**: Pilot store in Canada (September 2024) as gateway to 200+ potential stores.

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Skincare/makeup comp sales -low single-digits Q2; loyalty tendering pressure (5.6% sales from rewards); elevated promotions eroding margins (Q2 operating margin 13.7% vs. 15.5% YoY). | Record loyalty membership (+4% YoY); e.l.f./fragrance strength; new CEO ops focus for efficiency. |
| **Sector-Wide** | Beauty slowdown (U.S. prestige +2-3% vs. +10% prior; TikTok Shop/Amazon cannibalization); inflation on aspirational spend; Gen Z shift to DTC/low-price (e.g., CeraVe at Walmart). | $600B global beauty market (+5% CAGR); prestige recovery potential; omnichannel resilience (Ulta digital +4%). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Assortment**: 25,000+ SKUs: Prestige (35% sales), Mass (50%), Salon/Pro (15%).
- **Services**: Salon (hair/nails, 8% sales, +5.5% comp Q2).
- **Digital**: ulta.com (10% sales), app (40% e-comm).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Ulta Beauty Collection**: New color cosmetics line (Q3 2024 launch).
- **AI Personalization**: Shopper-specific recs via app (beta Q4 2024, full 2025).
- **GlamLab Expansion**: AR try-on in 500+ stores (2024 rollout).
- **Target Partnership Growth**: 50 more shop-in-shops by FY2025.
- **Canada Pilot**: First store September 2024; potential 10-15 by 2026.

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current U.S. Beauty Retail Share**: ~5-6% overall ($11B sales / $200B+ market); #1 standalone, ~25% prestige/mass combined with Sephora (Euromonitor 2023; company filings).
  - Prestige: Ulta ~12% (Sephora 15%).
  - Mass: Ulta ~8%.
- **Forecast**: Flat to +0.5% share gain FY2024-2026 via Target/stores (vs. Sephora's LCKD growth); risk of -1% loss if beauty recession persists (management commentary August 2024). Long-term: +1-2% via international/DTC.

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (FY2023 or Latest) | Ulta (ULTA) | Sephora (LVMH) | Sally Beauty (SBH) | e.l.f. Beauty (ELF)* |
|---------------------------|-------------|------------------|---------------------|----------------------|
| **Revenue**              | $11.2B     | ~$12B (est. U.S.) | $3.7B              | $1.0B               |
| **Stores**               | 1,450      | 500             | 3,800              | DTC-focused         |
| **Comp Sales Growth (Q2 '24)** | -0.5%   | +5-7% (est.)    | -4%                | +50%                |
| **Gross Margin**         | 39.6%      | 42%             | 45%                | 71%                 |
| **Market Cap**           | $19.6B     | N/A (parent)    | $1.3B              | $8.5B               |
| **Strengths vs. Ulta**   | -           | Prestige focus  | Pro/low-price      | Viral DTC/Gen Z     |

*Direct-to-consumer disruptor; Ulta carries e.l.f.

## Partnerships, M&A, Major Clients
- **Key Partnerships**: Target (100+ shop-in-shops since 2021, +double-digit sales growth); DoorDash (same-day delivery); brand exclusives (Dyson, Olaplex).
- **M&A**: None material since 2017 Acquire integration; opportunistic stance (CEO comments Q2 call).
- **Major Clients/Suppliers**: Suppliers include P&G, Estée Lauder, Coty (top 10 brands ~30% sales); end-clients are loyalty members (43M).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Strong on diversity (75% female execs); sustainability (50% recyclable packaging goal by 2025).
- **Moat**: Loyalty network effects (95% sales); real estate (prime malls); supply chain (private fleet).
- **Risks**: Consumer slowdown (McKinsey notes 2024 beauty spend flat); regulatory (CA Prop 65 chemical scrutiny).
- **Sentiment**: Analyst consensus "Hold" (27 analysts, avg. PT $429; Barclays Oct 1 downgrade to Equal Weight $390 on guidance cut).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **6/10 (Hold)**  
  Rationale: Attractive valuation (14x forward P/E vs. 5-yr avg 25x) with loyalty moat and Target tailwinds supporting mid-single-digit growth, but near-term headwinds (category weakness, guidance cuts) cap upside. YTD -25% decline prices in risks; moderate risk portfolio could hold for recovery.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $460 (12% upside from $413).  
  DCF-based (8% growth 3-yr tapering to 4%, 10% WACC, 3% terminal); aligns with avg. analyst PT $436-$450 (Bloomberg Oct 11). Strong growth upside if comp sales rebound to +3% FY2025.
